Position
Position

Defines a geographic position.

long_init,

)

initial latitude

initial longitude

Position
Position(
double 
lat_init,
double 
long_init,
double 
alt_init,
PositionVelocityReferenceFrame 
ref
= 
LLH_NED
) : referenceFrame(ref), position_0(lat_init), position_1(long_init), position_2(alt_init)

Creates a Position object.

Parameters
lat_init
double

initial latitude

long_init
double

initial longitude

alt_init
double

initial altitude

ref
PositionVelocityReferenceFrame

reference frame (default: LLH)

Position
Position() : referenceFrame(LLH_NED), position_0(0), position_1(0), position_2(0)

Creates a zero-filled Position object.  Default reference frame: LLH

~Position
~Position()

Destroys a TimeUpdate object.

Variables
referenceFrame
PositionVelocityReferenceFrame referenceFrame

The <PositionVelocityReferenceFrame> of this position.  Default: LLH

Functions
latitude
double latitude() const

Only valid if referenceFrame is LLH_NED

longitude
double longitude() const

Only valid if referenceFrame is LLH_NED

altitude
double altitude() const

Only valid if referenceFrame is LLH_NED

height
double height() const

Only valid if referenceFrame is LLH_NED

x
double x() const

Only valid if referenceFrame is ECEF

y
double y() const

Only valid if referenceFrame is ECEF

z
double z() const

Only valid if referenceFrame is ECEF

Variables
position_0, _1, _2

The position values
